automata

Class HOAF2DA

  • java.lang.Object
    • automata.HOAF2DA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    jhoafparser.consumer.HOAConsumer

    public class HOAF2DA
extends java.lang.Object
implements jhoafparser.consumer.HOAConsumer
    A HOAConsumer for jhoafparser that constructs a prism.DA from the parsed automaton.
    The automaton has to be deterministic and complete, with state-based acceptance and labels (explicit/implicit) on the edges.
    If the automaton has transition-based acceptance, TransitionBasedAcceptanceException is thrown.
    There are (currently) more restrictions on the automaton:
    • The Start and States headers have to be present
    • At least one state in the automaton.
    • All explicit edge labels have to be in disjunctive normal form (disjunction of conjunctive clauses)
    • At most 30 atomic propositions

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  HOAF2DA.TransitionBasedAcceptanceException
      An exception that is thrown to indicate that the automaton had transition based acceptance.

                                                  throws jhoafparser.consumer.HOAConsumerException
        Returns a list of APMonoms for the expression. The expression currently has to be in disjunctive normal form. Returns one APMonom for each clause of the DNF.
        Throws:
        jhoafparser.consumer.HOAConsumerException

                                      APMonom result)
                               throws jhoafparser.consumer.HOAConsumerException
        Returns a single APMonom for a single clause of the overall DNF formula. Modifies APMonom result such that in the end it is correct.
        Throws:
        jhoafparser.consumer.HOAConsumerException
